EmailTemplate.subject: Workshop, Friday 22nd November - Life with Teenagers Abroad
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Dear Parents, On Friday 22nd November, there will be a special seminar for ISM Parents run by Claire Geddes (9.45 - 11.30)
The topic is ' Life with Teenagers Abroad'.
The teenage years can be difficult - both for the child and the parents and the expat teenager has even more challenges to face. This workshop will look at the following topics:
Challenges facing teenagers abroad Managing independence in a different country Friendships and family relationships School, exams and the future Links with the past
The Seminar is especially interesting for parents of children in Year 7 and above.
The Seminar officially starts at 9.45 am on Friday 22nd November although there will be coffee available for attendees in the Upper Campus Canteen after drop off. Please click here to download the flyer
It would be helpful if you could book your place in advance - by emailing Claire (familygeddes@hotmail.com)Any questions then please email Claire.
The Seminar is sponsored by ISM and US Dental Care so there is no charge for parents.
